summary: This document appears to be a set of questions from an investigator or journalist to the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) regarding the handling of Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and suicide at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It details alleged failures by BOP staff, including monitoring lapses, delayed psychological evaluations, and inaccuracies in records. The BOP's responses, which are partially included, decline to comment on specifics about Epstein but outline general policy improvements and a task force on mental health.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at the center of the inquiry; the document details his time in BOP custody, his suicide attempt, his psychological assessments, and the BOP's handling of his case.

events.title: Recommendation for Epstein Suicide Risk Evaluation
events.description: A BOP employee recommended Jeffrey Epstein be evaluated for suicide risk.

events.title: Delayed Suicide Risk Assessment
events.description: The suicide risk assessment for Jeffrey Epstein, recommended the previous day, was conducted.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Closure of MCC New York
events.description: The Department of Justice decided to close the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York City, at least temporarily, to address facility issues.

keyFacts: BOP records indicate mistakes, sloppiness, and incompetence by some employees in dealing with Epstein, including failure to log social calls, delays in psych exams, inaccuracies in intake forms, and not providing a cellmate the night he died.
The BOP launched a task force to address the mental health implications of solitary confinement and is improving its suicide prevention program.
Epstein was reportedly subjected to a disciplinary process following his attempted suicide, with an incident report referring to the act as 'mutilation'.
A record indicating Epstein's suicide attempt incident report was 'expunged without explanation' was produced by the BOP.
The Department of Justice closed the MCC New York, at least temporarily, citing a need to address issues at the facility.
